TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: A portal between two points.

Tunable.name: allow_teleport_style_interaction_to_skip_portal
Tunable.display: Allow Teleport Style Interaction To Skip Portal
Tunable.description: If true, a Sim can skip the portal when using a teleport style. If false, a Sim must use the portal rather than teleporting past it.

TunableVariant.name: discouragement_flags
TunableVariant.description: If specified, only actors that have a routing context that doesn't match these flags, will be discouraged from traversing through the portal.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Discouragement flags for this portal.

TunableVariant.name: exclusion_flags
TunableVariant.description: If specified, only actors with a routing context that matches these flags, will be excluded from traversing through the portal.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Exclusion flags for this portal.

Tunable.name: max_agent_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum allowed radius an agent can have to traverse the portal.

TunableVariant.name: required_flags
TunableVariant.description: If specified, only actors with a routing context that match the required flags are allowed to traverse the portal.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Required flags for this portal.

TunableVariant.name: traversal_cost
TunableVariant.description: Define how expensive it is, in meters, to traverse this portal.

TunableTuple.name: asymmetrical_fixed_cost
TunableTuple.description: The cost of the portal depends on the direction the sim is taking through it.

TunableTuple.name: fixed_cost
TunableTuple.description: The cost of the portal is a fixed value, defined in meters.

TunableTuple.name: traversal_length
TunableTuple.description: The cost of the portal is defined as the distance between the entry and exit location. Optionally, multiply the value by a fixed multiplier.

TunableVariant.name: traversal_type
TunableVariant.description: Define the type of traversal for this portal.

TunableTuple.name: animation
TunableTuple.description: The Sim animates from the entry point to the exit point. The entry and exit points are defined by the animation's boundary conditions.

Tunable.name: animation_element
Tunable.description: The animation to play when a Sim traverses this portal.

TunableVariant.name: go_back_locations
TunableVariant.description: Location tunables for exiting through the portal. Talk to your GPE partner if you're unsure which direction is which.

TunableTuple.name: animation_back_portal
TunableTuple.description: Location tunables for exiting through the portal using animation constraints. Talk to your GPE partner if you're unsure which direction is which.

TunableTuple.name: bone_back_portal
TunableTuple.description: Location tunables for exiting through the portal using bones. Talk to your GPE partner if you're unsure which direction is which.

TunableTuple.name: back_end
TunableTuple.description: The location where exiting through the portal ends.

Tunable.name: bone_name
Tunable.description: The bone to use for this portal location.

TunableVariant.name: orientation_angle
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this portal has a specific orientation. If disabled, any orientation is valid.

TunableVariant.name: routing_surface
TunableVariant.description: Define what surface the point is created on. Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object is on. Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the object. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Global object: The point is anywhere on the object routable surface for the level where the object is on. If there is no object that location, the portal is invalid. Use this for objects that connect other objects with routable surfaces. Ocean: The point is in the ocean. Regardless of what level the object is on, we will always assume a surface type of POOL and a level of 0 (which would match the Ocean). Parent Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the owning object's parent. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Parent Object Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object's parent is on.

TunableTuple.name: back_start
TunableTuple.description: The location where exiting through the portal starts.

Tunable.name: bone_name
Tunable.description: The bone to use for this portal location.

TunableVariant.name: orientation_angle
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this portal has a specific orientation. If disabled, any orientation is valid.

Parent Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the owning object's parent. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Parent Object Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object's parent is on.

TunableTuple.name: one_way_only
TunableTuple.description: Ignores the back portal and makes this object one way only.

TunableVariant.name: go_there_locations
TunableVariant.description: Location tunables for entering through the portal. Talk to your GPE partner if you're unsure which direction is which.

TunableTuple.name: use_bone_locations
TunableTuple.description: Location tunables for entering through the portal. Talk to your GPE partner if you're unsure which direction is which.

TunableTuple.name: there_end
TunableTuple.description: The location where entering through the portal ends.

Tunable.description: The bone to use for this portal location.

TunableList.name: portal_events
TunableList.description: A list of portal events to add when a Sim uses the portal.

TunableVariant.description: The tuning for a specific portal event.

TunableTuple.name: change_opacity
TunableTuple.description: A portal event to change the opacity of the actor.

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: How long the change in opacity should take in seconds.

Tunable.name: opacity
Tunable.description: The target opacity to set the actor to. 0 is invisible and 1 is fully visible.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

TunableTuple.name: enter
TunableTuple.description: Notify the client that, at this time, the portal is in the 'enter' state. Depending the nature of the portal, this can be interpreted differently. For example, a Door portal with an ASM specified would, at this point, animate the door swinging open.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

TunableTuple.name: exit
TunableTuple.description: Notify the client that, at this time, the portal is in the 'exit' state. Depending the nature of the portal, this can be interpreted differently. For example, a Door portal with an ASM specified would, at this point, animate the door swinging shut.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

Tunable.name: requires_height_check
Tunable.description: If checked, We will check height between the portal points and the object's location. If either the portal entry point or the portal exit point is at a location whose y position differs by more than portal_height_offset_threshold from the object's, the portal is not created. Portal_height_offset_threshold is tuned at Native Build Buy Tuning.

Tunable.name: requires_los_between_entry_and_exit
Tunable.display: Requires Los Between Entry And Exit
Tunable.description: If checked, this portal will only be valid if there is LOS between the entry and exit points. If unchecked, LOS is not required.

TunableTuple.name: build_ladder
TunableTuple.description: A portal with dynamic locations based on the ladder object and its height. Allows sims to climb up and down build ladders through an extension of the default walkstyle.

TunableVariant.name: climb_down_locations
TunableVariant.description: Location tunables for climbing down the ladder. Optional because fly up portals don't need to climb down. NOTE: You must tune either Climb Up Locations or Climb Down Locations, or both.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Location tunables for climbing down the ladder. Optional because fly up portals don't need to climb down. NOTE: You must tune either Climb Up Locations or Climb Down Locations, or both.

TunableTuple.name: location_end
TunableTuple.description: The location at the bottom of the ladder where climbing down ends.

Tunable.name: bone_name

TunableTuple.name: dynamic_jump
TunableTuple.description: The portal is dynamically generated based on other objects in the world. The Sim will animate a variable jump from the specified entry point to points on other objects marked as valid landing locations, i.e. the entry locations of other dynamic portals.

TunableVariant.name: _height_tolerance
TunableVariant.description: Define the maximum height between the portal points and the object's location. If either the portal entry point or the portal exit point is at a location whose y position differs by more than this amount from the object's, the portal is not created.

Tunable.name: _require_los
Tunable.description: If checked, portals are created only if the segment between them does not intersect other objects or a wall. If unchecked, no such restriction exists. This should be unchecked on portals that are meant to be traversed through a wall, e.g. a door.

Tunable.name: additional_search_radius
Tunable.description: Define an additional value in meters to increase the search for other surfaces when a dynamic portal is generated. This should be tuned for objects where the width is too high and we need to take into account their placements can be farther apart than a regular object like a counter which only uses the default radius.

TunableVariant.name: angle_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, dynamic portals will only be generated when the angle is within the angle restriction (counter-clockwise from start-angle to end-angle). This won't be necessary for many cases. However, when dynamic portal only be allowed to generate from specific sides of the object (ex. front and left sides for Hamster Cage object), this will be useful.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Angle restriction in degrees, value range of 0-360.

Tunable.name: animation_element
Tunable.description: The animation to play when a Sim traverses this portal.

TunableVariant.name: bidirectional_portal_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, portals defined on this object, will have an offset applied to the entry portal of bidirectional portals. The offset will be applied only to the object surface point of the entry portal created by bidirectional portals. For example: If you make a bidirectional portal from ground to a counter, the point on the counter for the entry portal will have an offset applied. This way, portals can be generated for Sims like Cats, where the entry point should have a small difference to the exit due animation constraints.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Offset in meters that will be applied to the entry portal.

Tunable.name: entry_offset
Tunable.description: Define an offset that will be used for any dynamic portal entering this object. By definition all dynamic portals use the center, but by tuning this the portal may allow for an offset from the center so the Sim can get in closer to the edge of the object whenever it wants to enter.

Tunable.name: exit_offset
Tunable.description: Define an offset that will be used for any dynamic portal exiting this object. By definition all dynamic portals use the center, but by tuning this the portal may allow for an offset from the center so the Sim can get in closer to the edge of the object whenever it wants to exit.

TunableList.name: object_portals
TunableList.description: List of entry and exit location points that will define the entry and exit portal to and from this object.

TunableTuple.description: Pair of exit and entry portal locations.

TunableTuple.name: location_entry
TunableTuple.description: The entry portal.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this portal has a specific orientation. If disabled, any orientation is valid.

TunableTuple.name: change_opacity
TunableTuple.description: A portal event to change the opacity of the actor.

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: How long the change in opacity should take in seconds.

Tunable.name: opacity
Tunable.description: The target opacity to set the actor to. 0 is invisible and 1 is fully visible.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

TunableTuple.name: enter
TunableTuple.description: Notify the client that, at this time, the portal is in the 'enter' state. Depending the nature of the portal, this can be interpreted differently. For example, a Door portal with an ASM specified would, at this point, animate the door swinging open.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

TunableTuple.name: exit
TunableTuple.description: Notify the client that, at this time, the portal is in the 'exit' state. Depending the nature of the portal, this can be interpreted differently. For example, a Door portal with an ASM specified would, at this point, animate the door swinging shut.

Tunable.name: time

TunableTuple.name: dynamic_stairs
TunableTuple.description: The stairs portal is dynamically created based on the provided tuning and the object to which this component is attached.

TunableList.name: lanes
TunableList.description: The bones that describe each set of lanes (up and down).

TunableTuple.description: Groups of bones that represent the up and down routes for this lane.

TunableTuple.name: down_begin
TunableTuple.description: The bone for the beginning of the path down the stairs.

Tunable.name: bone_name
Tunable.description: The bone to use for this portal location.

TunableVariant.name: orientation_angle
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this portal has a specific orientation. If disabled, any orientation is valid.

TunableVariant.name: routing_surface
TunableVariant.description: Define what surface the point is created on. Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object is on. Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the object. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Global object: The point is anywhere on the object routable surface for the level where the object is on. If there is no object that location, the portal is invalid. Use this for objects that connect other objects with routable surfaces. Ocean: The point is in the ocean. Regardless of what level the object is on, we will always assume a surface type of POOL and a level of 0 (which would match the Ocean). Parent Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the owning object's parent. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Parent Object Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object's parent is on.

TunableEnum.description: Which direction this portal is aligned. This direction is used to determine which animation to play when getting on/off the top of ladder since there are three entrance/exit portals at the top of the ladder.

Tunable.name: duration

Tunable.name: opacity
Tunable.description: The target opacity to set the actor to. 0 is invisible and 1 is fully visible.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

TunableTuple.name: enter
TunableTuple.description: Notify the client that, at this time, the portal is in the 'enter' state. Depending the nature of the portal, this can be interpreted differently. For example, a Door portal with an ASM specified would, at this point, animate the door swinging open.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

TunableTuple.name: exit
TunableTuple.description: Notify the client that, at this time, the portal is in the 'exit' state. Depending the nature of the portal, this can be interpreted differently. For example, a Door portal with an ASM specified would, at this point, animate the door swinging shut.

Tunable.name: time

TunableTuple.description: The Sim locomotes up from the water to land or down from land to water.

TunableTuple.name: climb_down_locations
TunableTuple.description: Location tunables for climbing down the ladder.

TunableTuple.name: location_end
TunableTuple.description: The location at the bottom of the ladder where climbing down ends.

TunableVariant.name: orientation_angle
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this portal has a specific orientation. If disabled, any orientation is valid.

TunableVariant.name: routing_surface
TunableVariant.description: Define what surface the point is created on. Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object is on. Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the object. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Global object: The point is anywhere on the object routable surface for the level where the object is on. If there is no object that location, the portal is invalid. Use this for objects that connect other objects with routable surfaces. Ocean: The point is in the ocean. Regardless of what level the object is on, we will always assume a surface type of POOL and a level of 0 (which would match the Ocean). Parent Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the owning object's parent. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Parent Object Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object's parent is on.

TunableTuple.description: The Sim does not animate via the traversal type. It comes from a posture change on the portal.

Tunable.name: _lock_portal_on_use
Tunable.description: If checked, only one sim is allowed to use the portal at a time. Otherwise, multiple sims can use the portal at the same time.

TunableVariant.name: _outfit_change
TunableVariant.description: Define the outfit change that happens when a Sim enters or exits this portal.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: Define the outfit change that happens when a Sim enters or exits this portal.

TunableTuple.name: for_new
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change that generates a new outfit and then applies it to the Sim.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_change_behavior
TunableTuple.description: Generate a new outfit in the specified category.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: The outfit category for which we're creating a new outfit.

TunableTuple.name: for_reason
TunableTuple.description: Define individual outfit changes at each of the transition points.

TunableVariant.name: on_entry
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, define the change reason to apply on posture entry.

TunableVariant.name: on_exit
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, define the change reason to apply on posture exit.

TunableTuple.name: for_tags
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit to apply for the duration of the OutfitChange's owner generated from the specified tags.

TunableVariant.name: on_entry
TunableVariant.description: The tuning for how to handle the outfit change on entry of the new context.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Contains the tags used to tune the outfit and also a preference for whether or not to automatically switch out of the tags outfit when on exit.

Tunable.name: auto_undo_on_exit
Tunable.description: If True then the Sim will switch out of the entry tag outfit on exit. If False then the Sim will stay in the tag outfit. NOTE: This tuning conflicts with the On Exit tuning. If this is set to true and On Exit is enabled then an error should occur on load because you can't both switch out of the tag outfit and switch into a different tag outfit.

Tunable.name: do_spin
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will animate and perform a clothing change spin. If unchecked, the Sim will change outfits without animating.

TunableVariant.name: generator
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A helper that generates outfits for a Sim. The tunables control aspects of randomization, such as tags, weights, overrides, etc...

TunableList.name: blocked_tags
TunableList.description: The set of prohibited tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must not match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: body_type_chance_overrides
TunableList.description: Define body type chance overrides for the generate outfit. For example, if BODYTYPE_HAT is mapped to 100%, then the outfit is guaranteed to have a hat if any hat matches the specified tags. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated, regardless of their percent chance.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The chance that a part is applied to the corresponding body type.

TunableList.name: body_type_match_not_found_policy
TunableList.display: Body Type Match Not Found Policy
TunableList.description: The policy we should take for a body type that we fail to find a match for. Primary example is to use MATCH_NOT_FOUND_KEEP_EXISTING for generating a tshirt and making sure a sim wearing full body has a lower body cas part. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated.

TunableList.name: filter_flag
TunableList.description: Define how to handle part randomization for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The set of tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_to_modify
TunableVariant.description: The outfit we want to generate over.

TunableTuple.name: current
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use a Sim's current outfit.

Tunable.name: restrict_to_regular
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will switch out of any non-regular outfits (and into Everyday) before applying the modification. If this is unchecked, the Sim will modify whatever outfit they are wearing, including, for example, career outfits. The modification is permanent.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_category
TunableTuple.description: OutfitVariant to use one of the Sim's outfit categories.

TunableTuple.name: special
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use special outfits.

TunableEnum.name: special_outfit_index
TunableEnum.description: The Special outfit index to use when creating the outfit using the provided flags. There are multiple Special outfits that are indexed by the entries in the SpecialOutfitIndex enum. GPE NOTE: If you want to add a new index you will need to add a value to SpecialOutfitIndex as well as change the values in outfit_tuning.py and OutfitTypes.h to allow for more special outfits.

TdescFragTag.name: tests

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change that takes the current outfit from the specified source and applies it to the Sim, in a specified way (such as a temporary application or a permanent addition).

TunableVariant.name: outfit_change_behavior
TunableVariant.description: Define how this outfit is to be applied to the Sim.

TunableTuple.name: addition
TunableTuple.description: The outfit on the source is copied and added to the Sim's outfits (matching the category on the source). The Sim is then switched to it.

TunableTuple.name: temporary
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is switched into the outfit from the participant temporarily. On exit, they are returned to the previous outfit.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_participant
TunableEnum.description: The Sim or object whose current outfit is going to be temporarily applied to the Sim being affected by this change.

TunableTuple.name: from_picker

Tunable.name: do_spin

TunableTuple.name: on_exit
TunableTuple.description: The outfit change happens on exit.

TunableTuple.name: from_zone
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is switched into the zone-specified outfit. This tracked as a temporary outfit which does not persist.

Tunable.name: auto_undo_on_exit
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will use the previous outfit as the on_exit outfit for this outfit change. Has no effect for outfit changes that do not perform an on_exit change, such as on_route outfit changes.

TunableTuple.name: no_change

Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

TunableTuple.name: enter
TunableTuple.description: Notify the client that, at this time, the portal is in the 'enter' state. Depending the nature of the portal, this can be interpreted differently. For example, a Door portal with an ASM specified would, at this point, animate the door swinging open.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

TunableTuple.name: exit
TunableTuple.description: Notify the client that, at this time, the portal is in the 'exit' state. Depending the nature of the portal, this can be interpreted differently. For example, a Door portal with an ASM specified would, at this point, animate the door swinging shut.

Tunable.name: time
Tunable.description: The time from when the portal happens. A positive number is after the portal happens and a negative number is before a portal happens. So if you want a sim to fade out before using a portal the value here should be -1.

Tunable.name: supports_landing_shoo
Tunable.description: If True, sims standing on a stair landing on the object on which this portal exists will be shooed from the path of the stairs if another sim attempts to use the stairs. This is to avoid clipping.

TunableTuple.name: teleport
TunableTuple.description: The Sim teleports from the entry point to the exit point both of which are specified by objects and the tuned offsets.

TunableVariant.name: _height_tolerance
TunableVariant.description: Define the maximum height between the portal points and the object's location. If either the portal entry point or the portal exit point is at a location whose y position differs by more than this amount from the object's, the portal is not created.

Tunable.name: _require_los
Tunable.description: If checked, portals are created only if the segment between them does not intersect other objects or a wall. If unchecked, no such restriction exists. This should be unchecked on portals that are meant to be traversed through a wall, e.g. a door.

TunableVariant.name: bidirectional_portal_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, portals defined on this object, will have an offset applied to the entry portal of bidirectional portals. The offset will be applied only to the object surface point of the entry portal created by bidirectional portals. For example: If you make a bidirectional portal from ground to a counter, the point on the counter for the entry portal will have an offset applied. This way, portals can be generated for Sims like Cats, where the entry point should have a small difference to the exit due animation constraints.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Offset in meters that will be applied to the entry portal.

TunableEnum.description: A list of tags used to find objects that this object connects with to form two sides of a portal. When the portals are created all of the objects on the lot with at least one of the tags found in this list are found and a portal is created between the originating object and the described object.

TunableList.name: object_portals
TunableList.description: List of entry and exit location points that will define the entry and exit portal to and from this object.

TunableTuple.description: Pair of exit and entry portal locations.

Tunable.name: is_bidirectional
Tunable.description: If checked, then a portal with the same exact properties is created from the exit location to the entry location. If unchecked, then only one portal is created: from the entry location to the exit location.

TunableVariant.name: location_entry
TunableVariant.description: The entry portal

TunableTuple.name: bone_name
TunableTuple.description: The bone location.

Tunable.name: bone_name
Tunable.description: The bone to use for this portal location.

TunableVariant.name: orientation_angle
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this portal has a specific orientation. If disabled, any orientation is valid.

TunableVariant.name: routing_surface
TunableVariant.description: Define what surface the point is created on. Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object is on. Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the object. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Global object: The point is anywhere on the object routable surface for the level where the object is on. If there is no object that location, the portal is invalid. Use this for objects that connect other objects with routable surfaces. Ocean: The point is in the ocean. Regardless of what level the object is on, we will always assume a surface type of POOL and a level of 0 (which would match the Ocean). Parent Object: The point is on the routable surface defined by the owning object's parent. The point must be within the footprint's bounds. Parent Object Terrain: The point is on the ground, on the same level the owning object's parent is on.

TunableTuple.name: location
TunableTuple.description: The offset.
